issue.title: [CF 406] Some debuffs missing in the debuff categories
issue.body:
I used to have an icon that named every single debuff I wanted to check for. Recently I became aware that you could just name debuffs per group like "rooted" or "stunned". The icon is much tidier now, but I have experienced that some debuffs don't seem to be properly working. Intimidating Shout for example appears if you get feared by the aoe-effect. However it is absent if you are the target of Intimidating Shout, in which case the debuff has a different spell-ID (20511). I think I have experienced this with other debuffs too, but I can't say for sure because that ususally happened in the middle of some aoe-fest, where I couldn't check.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #406 | Raw

comments.body:
Added 20511 to Feared. Let me know of any other missing buffs/debuffs that you come across.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

83073 or Shattered Barrier is missing from Roots.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Actually I just found this useful Wowhead page: http://www.wowhead.com/spells=-8?filter=me=7

You can also search for other categories with the filtering options at the top. Yeah, it's a lot of work, maybe too much. I just wanted to point it out.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

The problem with those filters is that half the spells included in them are wrong. I could easily write a script to go through and extract them all (I get enrages from Sigrie and currencies from Wowhead with scripts), but the problem is that there are a large number that are incorrect, which would require manual filtering, essentially defeating the purpose of using a script.

Just at a glance, Soul Chill, Sticky Webbing, Zapper Gun, Enveloping Web, and Bind Feet are all not roots.

The other problem is that when the equivalency is expanded internally in TMW, it significantly increases CPU usage unless the number in the equivalency was already greater than the Buff Efficiency Threshold setting before all the new ones were added. Generally, equivalencies only include player spells. NPC spells can always be tacked on manually, as in "Rooted; Magical Crappy Root; 12345")


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Entangling Roots is listed in the Crowd Control category, even though it's really just a root.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

But it can be used as a crowd control against melee in instances, and it breaks after a certain amount of damage, which is why it is there.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

But I can still hit people in melee-range, which cannot be said of any other debuff in the category. Also, by that logic, shouldn't the mageroots be in this category aswell?

Edit: Oh, and I can Bladestorm during Entangling Roots, but not during regular cc, which also can be of major importance.

Edit 2: And of course if you are a range, you might not care as much for Entangling Roots as you do for Hammer of Justice. Having a separate category only for debuffs, which remove all character control just seems sensible to me.

Edited Jan 8, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

But it is usually cast before the pull where mobs will never have a chance of being in melee range. And it lasts 30 seconds - mage roots only last a few seconds.

But, I see your point. I will take it out and put some upgrade code in to make sure users don't see random unexpected changes.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
